pullrequest.title: SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin: checked if body is one of the tracks before applying force to it to prevent multiple instances of this plugin interfering with each other.

content.raw: I’ve added a test for this: [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3148/added-tests-for-driving-multiple-tracked](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3148/added-tests-for-driving-multiple-tracked/diff) .
content.html: I’ve added a test for this: #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3148/added-tests-for-driving-multiple-tracked .

pull_request.title: SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin: checked if body is one of the tracks before applying force to it to prevent multiple instances of this plugin interfering with each other.

update.description:
[#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2666/simpletrackedvehicleplugin-multiple](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2666/simpletrackedvehicleplugin-multiple)

If multiple vehicles using the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin plugin are created, they interfere with each other because each instance of the plugin considers all track bodies \(not just those of the plugin instance’s model\) as tracks of the model.

I believe this is due to a lack of checking if the bodies of the contact joints that are used to move the vehicle are actually the tracks of this vehicle. The plugin does use category bits but uses the same category bits for all instances of the plugin.

I have added code to explicitly check if the bodies are tracks and this is working for my use case.
update.title: SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin: checked if body is one of the tracks before applying force to it to prevent multiple instances of this plugin interfering with each other.

content.raw:
Thanks for noticing! It’s true I’ve never tested more vehicles in one world.

Can I ask you to restrict the changes just to the added lines and to not change the whitespace on lines you don’t need to change?

Otherwise, if the code passes code\_check.sh, it looks good to me.

‌
content.html:
Thanks for noticing! It’s true I’ve never tested more vehicles in one world.

Can I ask you to restrict the changes just to the added lines and to not change the whitespace on lines you don’t need to change?

Otherwise, if the code passes code_check.sh, it looks good to me.

‌
